ui_surfaces.navigation_path: Profiler > Profiler Configuration > Forward and Sync Endpoint Data

inputs.name: Community List
inputs.help_text: Enter the possible community list names, separated by commas, to collect device attributes for endpoints monitored through SNMP.

inputs.name: Polling Interval
inputs.help_text: Set the interval (in minutes) for polling SNMP devices.

inputs.name: Subnets
inputs.help_text: Enter one or more subnets for device discovery and profiling.

inputs.name: Include/Exclude Collectors
inputs.help_text: Select whether to include or exclude the listed collectors (e.g., SSH, WMI, SNMP, NMAP).

inputs.name: FQDN or IP Address
inputs.help_text: Enter the FQDN or IP address of the profiler or backup profiler to sync data.

inputs.name: API Key
inputs.help_text: Enter the API key for syncing endpoint data. Optionally, validate the server certificate to retrieve the API key.

inputs.name: Timeframe
inputs.help_text: Set the timeframe for displaying data in the dashboard (e.g., 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, All).

inputs.name: Refresh Interval
inputs.help_text: Set the refresh interval for updating dashboard charts (e.g., 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, Disabled).

inputs.name: Charts Per Row
inputs.help_text: Set the number of charts to display per row in the dashboard (e.g., 1, 2, 3).

actions.description: Clear the settings and revert to default values.
Trigger an immediate scan on the selected subnets using the selected collectors.
Retrieve and auto-fill the API key by entering administrator credentials.

constraints.constraint: Maximum 100 subnets can be configured for device discovery.
If the number of discovered devices exceeds 1000, manually add subnets to scan only Windows devices.
NMAP is supported only for devices in the same subnet as PPS for on-demand scans.

errors.description: Invalid community list format. Ensure names are separated by commas.
Exceeded maximum subnet configuration limit of 100.

steps: Navigate to Profiler > Profiler Configuration > SNMP (Host) Profiling.
Enter the community list names separated by commas.
Optionally, select the option to profile all discovered devices using SNMP.
Navigate to Profiler > Profiler Configuration > Forward and Sync Endpoint Data.
Enter the FQDN or IP address of the profiler or backup profiler.
Enter the API key or retrieve it using administrator credentials.

image_insights.insights: The Profiler Basic Configuration screen includes options to save, reset, or delete the profiler configuration.
The SNMP (Host) Profiling screen allows configuration of community lists and polling intervals for device attribute collection.
The Subnets Configuration screen supports adding subnets, selecting collectors, and triggering on-demand scans.
The Profiler Reports Dashboard displays device profiling statistics with customizable charts and timeframes.
